exist_unemp: unemployment benefit programme
unemp_fl_no: Act of 12th April, 1925. Bulgarian Law Gazette (???????? ???????) 1925, No. 26, p.1
unemp_fl_beneficiaries: All wage-earning and salaried employees (aged 15-60) liable to social insurance of any kind, seamen, and wage-earning employees in State, departmental, communal and public departments and undertakings (if their posts are not provided for in the estimates for the established staff of the department or undertaking in question and they are not covered by the Act respecting pensions for employees in institutions belonging to the State and local authorities). Excluded: domestic servants and agricultural workers except they are employed in agricultural undertakings which under the Act respecting agricultural holdings are deemed to be conducted on modern lines.

exist_unemp: unemployment benefit programme
unemp_fl_beneficiaries: Employees in industrial and commercial sectors. Excluded: agriculture, forestry, hunting and fishing; lumbering and logging; transportation by water or by air; domestic services; teaching; government employees and public service, employment with remuneration > 2000 dollars per year, employment in the service of husband, employees paid fpr playing any game

exist_unemp: unemployment benefit programme
unemp_fl_no: Public—No.271, 74th Congress] [H. R .7260], approved 14th August, 1935 (Social Security Act)
unemp_fl_beneficiaries: Unemployment insurance (including coverage) is regulated by the states. In 1937, all 48 states  have enacted legislations.
unemp_fl_financing: State levies a pay-roll tax of 1 percent in 1936 (2 percent in 1937, and 3 percent in 1938) on employers of eight or more persons. Employers paying taxes receive a credit against the tax (up to 90%)

exist_unemp: unemployment benefit programme
unemp_fl_no: French Finance Act, Loi du 22 avril 1905

unemp_fl_financing: Government, employees. States grants subsidies to unemployment funds equalling 16 to 24 % of  the benefits paid by the funds

exist_unemp: unemployment benefit programme
unemp_fl_no: Labour Market Regulations Act of 28 September 2010 (Text No. 4304)
unemp_fl_beneficiaries: Employed persons, including public-sector employees and self-employed persons. Voluntary coverage for citizens employed by foreign employers in certain foreign countries and their family members.

exist_unemp: unemployment benefit programme
unemp_fl_no: Gaceta de Madrid, Boletin del Instituto de Reformas Sociales, num. CLXXIX 1919, p. 620
unemp_fl_beneficiaries: Voluntary insurance open to employees with salary < 4,000 peseta
unemp_fl_financing: Government and employees. The state grants a subsidy, equal to the total amount of the actual premiums collected, to workers' friendly societies operating an insurance against involuntary unemployment. Subsidies are tied to certain criteria spelled out in this Royal Decree.

exist_unemp: unemployment benefit programme
unemp_fl_beneficiaries: Voluntary insurance open to employees aged 16 and over
unemp_fl_financing: Government and employees. The state grants a subsidy to recognised unemployment funds. Subsidies are tied to certain criteria spelled out in the Law.

exist_unemp: unemployment benefit programme
unemp_fl_beneficiaries: Unemployed salaried employees who are members of private or public unemployment funds operated by unions, cantons or municipalities
unemp_fl_financing: Government: The Federal government provided subsidies to private and public unemployment funds operated at the local and cantonal level. These funds had to fulfil certain criteria spelled out by this federal law. Federal subsidies covered 30-40% of daily benefit paid to the unemployed

exist_unemp: unemployment benefit programme
unemp_fl_beneficiaries: Workmen in 7 trades whose risk of unemployment is serious: building; construction of works; shipbuilding; mechanical engineering; ironfounding; construction of vehicles; sawmilling

exist_unemp: unemployment benefit programme
unemp_fl_beneficiaries: Universal but means-tested benefit. Every person who  (a) has attained the age of 16 years but has not attained the age of 65 years, or, in the case of a female 60 years; (b) is residing in Australia  for not less than one year. Married women and Aboriginal natives are excluded.
